title: Kyrsten Sinema
deleted: In 2018 Sinema was the subject of public criticism in Republican campaign ads for previous comments that she made during a 2007 legislative committee hearing that debated SB1268 a senate bill that would stiffen legal penalties for people who solicited underage sex trafficking victims. In video of the "House Natural Resources and Public Safety" committee hearing on SB1268 Sinema said:

“I’m just not convinced that enforcing a strict liability on those johns who are engaging in prostitution is really the answer, and as a former social worker at an elementary school, there were children at my school who were 12, 13 years old and some of these children looked older than me. They were much more – I mean, definitely sophisticated, developed – and if I had seen a number of my former students in a place other than in a sixth-grade classroom, I would not have known that those children were 12 instead of 19 or 20. And so I do have a real concern for those individuals, and if one of those young girls were conscripted into prostitution and a john were to approach her, he’d be facing a class 2 felony for unknowingly soliciting sex from a 12-year-old who appeared to be a 20-year-old.”<ref>{{cite web|title=Attack ad hits Arizona Senate candidate Kyrsten Sinema for past comments on underage prostitution |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/11/politics/kyrsten-sinema-defend-arizona-gop-attack-ad/index.html |Television Network=CNN|access-date=September 17, 2021}}</ref>

Sinema ultimately voted for the bill which was amended to allow solicitors of underage sex trafficking victims 15 years old & older, to defend themselves in court utilizing the argument that they couldn't determine the sex trafficking victim's age.<ref>{{cite web|title=HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES

SB 1268 sex trafficking; child prostitution Sponsor: Senator Gray, C.|url=https://www.azleg.gov/legtext/48leg/1r/summary/h.sb1268_06-11-07_houseengrossed.doc.htm|=AZ Legal.gov|access-date=September 17, 2021}}</ref>

title: Kyrsten Sinema
deleted: In 2018 Sinema was the subject of public criticism in Republican campaign ads for previous comments that she made during a 2007 legislative committee hearing that debated SB1268 a senate bill that would stiffen legal penalties for people who solicited underage sex trafficking victims. In video of the "House Natural Resources and Public Safety" committee hearing on SB1268 Sinema said:

“I’m just not convinced that enforcing a strict liability on those johns who are engaging in prostitution is really the answer, and as a former social worker at an elementary school, there were children at my school who were 12, 13 years old and some of these children looked older than me. They were much more – I mean, definitely sophisticated, developed – and if I had seen a number of my former students in a place other than in a sixth-grade classroom, I would not have known that those children were 12 instead of 19 or 20. And so I do have a real concern for those individuals, and if one of those young girls were conscripted into prostitution and a john were to approach her, he’d be facing a class 2 felony for unknowingly soliciting sex from a 12-year-old who appeared to be a 20-year-old.”<ref>[url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/11/politics/kyrsten-sinema-defend-arizona-gop-attack-ad/index.html](September 17, 2021)</ref>

Sinema ultimately voted for the bill which was amended to allow solicitors of underage sex trafficking victims 15 years old & older, to defend themselves in court utilizing the argument that they couldn't determine the sex trafficking victim's age.<ref>[url=https://www.azleg.gov/legtext/48leg/1r/summary/h.sb1268_06-11-07_houseengrossed.doc.htm]access-date=September 17, 2021}}</ref>

title: Kyrsten Sinema
deleted: She dislikes being assualted by activists while using the toilet.

title: Kyrsten Sinema
deleted: Sinema has credited the government, her church, her teachers, and her family for helping her overcome poverty.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Robillard|first1=Kevin|last2=Caygle|first2=Heather|title=Democratic Rep. Sinema launches Arizona senate bid|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2017/09/28/kyrsten-sinema-launches-arizona-senate-bid-243278|access-date=January 18, 2018|website=Politico|date=September 28, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109191245/https://www.politico.com/story/2017/09/28/kyrsten-sinema-launches-arizona-senate-bid-243278|archive-date=November 9, 2017|url-status=live|df=mdy-all}}</ref>

title: Kyrsten Sinema
added: In 2021, Sinema opposed prescription drug pricing reform proposals in House and Senate versions of a Democrat-crafted spending bill. Sinema and West Virginia Senator Joe Manchin met with President Biden the same day to discuss their concerns with the bills. Observers have noted that Sinema is one of the largest benefactors of pharmaceutical political action committee money in the House.<ref name="politico-drugs">{{cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/19/kyrsten-sinema-biden-drug-pricing-prescription-plan-512907|publisher=Politico|title=Sinema tells White House she’s opposed to current prescription drug plan|access-date=2021-10-15}}</ref><ref name="guardian-bigpharma">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2021/oct/11/big-pharma-has-a-powerful-new-shill-kyrsten-sinema-fighting-drug-price-reform|publisher=The Guardian|title=
Big pharma has a powerful new shill, Kyrsten Sinema, fighting drug price reform|access=date=2021-10-15}}</ref>

title: Kyrsten Sinema
added: In 2021, Sinema opposed prescription drug pricing reform proposals in House and Senate versions of a Democrat-crafted spending bill. Sinema and West Virginia Senator Joe Manchin met with President Biden the same day to discuss their concerns with the bills. Observers have noted that Sinema is one of the largest benefactors of pharmaceutical political action committee money in the House.<ref name="politico-drugs">{{cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/19/kyrsten-sinema-biden-drug-pricing-prescription-plan-512907|publisher=Politico|title=Sinema tells White House she’s opposed to current prescription drug plan|access-date=2021-10-15}}</ref>
